title: How to Disable LED Flash for Alerts on an iPhone

steps.title: Tap the grey cog icon on one of your Home screens.
steps.content: Tap the grey cog icon on one of your Home screens. If your Settings app is in a folder, the folder will be named "Utilities."

steps.title: The Accessiblity menu is in the third group of settings.
steps.content: The Accessiblity menu is in the third group of settings. You can control multiple accessibility features here.

steps.title: The Audo/Visual menu is under the "Hearing" heading.
steps.content: The Audo/Visual menu is under the "Hearing" heading. It's near the bottom of the section.

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "LED Flash for Alerts" to turn it off .
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "LED Flash for Alerts" to turn it off . The switch will turn gray, signifying that your iPhone will no longer flash when you receive alerts.
